curated_text: Symbol: PFE. Year: 2025. Period: Q2. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: BMS, the Court of Appeal, the Supreme Court, CureVac AG, CureVac, the German Regional Court, PFIZER INC., UNAUDITED, Comirnaty, Trademark Office, the European Patent Office, FDA, District Court, Alkem Laboratories Ltd., Alkem, Annora Pharma Private Limited, Teva Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Teva, Vyndaqel-Vyndamax, Scripps Research Institute, Scripps, Zydus Pharmaceuticals, Zydus Lifesciences Limited, MSN Pharmaceuticals Inc., MSN Laboratories Private Ltd., MSN, Rubicon Research Private Limited, Changzhou Pharmaceutical Factory, Aurobindo Pharma U.S.A. Inc., Apotex Inc., Apotex Corp., Sandoz Inc., Sandoz, the U.S., Inlyta., Alnylam Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Alnylam, Pfizer, Pharmacia & Upjohn Company LLC, ModernaTX, Inc., ModernaTX, Moderna US, US Inc., the U.S. Patent Office Patent Trial & Appeal Board, the U.S. Patent Office, Arbutus Biopharma Corporation, Arbutus, Genevant Sciences GmbH, GlaxoSmithKline Biologicals SA, LLC, GSK Group, the Unified Patent Court, Local Division Munich, Enanta Pharmaceuticals, Inc., the District Court, Enanta, the GSK Group, GSK Group’s Arexvy, GSK, RSV, the U.K. Court, Company, Collaboration/Licensing Partners Comirnaty, the U.S. District Court, Sumitomo Pharma America, Takeda and Takeda Pharmaceuticals International AG, Warner-Lambert, American Optical Corporation, American Optical, Docetaxel, MDL, Zantac, Zantac OTC, Johnson & Johnson, the Federal MDL Court, the Federal MDL Court’s, the State of New Mexico, City Council of Baltimore, Judicial Council Coordinated Proceeding, the Superior Court of California, the Superior Court of Delaware, Champix, MPA, Monsanto Company, Monsanto, Solutia Inc., Pharmacia & Upjohn Company, Solutia, New Monsanto, Bayer AG, Wyeth Holdings Corporation, American Cyanamid Company, Bound Brook, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, the New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection, the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Iraqi Ministry of Health In, the Iraqi Ministry of Health, the Court of Appeals, the District Court’s, the U.S. Supreme Court, Allergan Finance LLC, the State of New York, Breach of Contract – Comirnaty, Court of First Instance of Brussels, Court. Context excerpt: competition and/or violations of antitrust laws. In addition to the challenges to the U.S. patents that are discussed below, patent rights to certain of our products or those of our collaboration/licensing partners are being challenged in various other jurisdictions. Some of our collaboration or licensing partners face challenges to the validity of their patent rights in non-U.S. jurisdictions. For example, in April 2022, the U.K. High Court issued a judgment finding invalid a BMS patent related to Eliquis due to expire in 2026. In May 2023, the Court of Appeal dismissed BMS’s appeal and in October 2023, the Supreme Court refused BMS permission to appeal. Additional challenges are pending in other jurisdictions. Also, in July 2022, CureVac AG (CureVac) brought a patent infringement action against BioNTech and certain of its subsidiaries in the German Regional Court alleging that Comirnaty infringes certain German utility model patents and certain expired and unexpired European patents.
